column2: mlly21, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I used it for three days and it made my condition worse. I had more frequency and felt pressure all the time. I stopped taking it after the third day. Waste of time!

column2: joiz, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I thought I had found the miracle cure for my urinary urgency.  Santura was working really well and I was recommending it to all my friends who also had issues.  I had taken the medication for about 2 1/2 months when I started having trouble reading fine print at work and needed to use my "cheaters" all the time.  I also noticed that my distant glasses that I use for driving did not work anymore as they made the distance blurry and I had to take them off.  I am assuming that my vision problems are caused by this medication and stopped using it about four days ago.  I will not use this again as the vision problems far outweigh my urgency to urinate problems.  I only hope in time my vision returns to the way it was before I started using Santura.  Has anyone had permanent vision issues?

column2: bjames, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on this medication two weeks, It has decreased my need to urinate somewhat, but the side effects of dry mouth, dry nose, and constipation are not worth it...I would continue it if it weren't for the side effects.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I can't sleep at night for urinating constantly.  Plus I have to change panties & pads each time.  I can't get to the bathroom in time.  The problem has been much worse with this medication.

column2: happy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: SXR FAN, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Lynnie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The medicine has helped the overactive bladder but constipation and dry mouth are problems but my biggest problem is a very bad skin rash that can only be caused by this medication.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Greatly improved all problems, urgency, frequency, leakage, etc.  Slight constipation, which eating a prune or two every day or 2, helps.  Dry mouth most annoying, as my jobs requires a lot of talking... not as annoying as all the problems it has fixed!

column2: Joey, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: No such thing as a wonder drug, but this comes close for me. Before I would go 3 times a night and while at work was finding it very difficult to get through a meeting. I even wetted my bed once, and I'm 38 years old. Prostate check out to be normal, just an overactive bladder. Still don't know why I have this condition, but this medication has returned me back to normal. Side effects include difficulty reading fine print and makes me a little groggy in the morning since I take it before I go to bed.

column2: formeng, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had urinary urgency and frequent urination (getting up sometimes 6 to 8 times a night) for several years.  I have been taking Sanctura XR, 60 mg for about a month.  I have noted a moderate decrease in urgency, but no significant change in frequency.

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have had severe side effects with this drug.  I was sent in for abdominal CT scans and no one was able to find the cause of the pain in my gut.  I finally went to WebMD and discovered on my own that my intense stomach pain, dry mouth, dry eyes and blurred vision was caused by this drug.  I would not recommend it.  Sometimes the side effects are just too bad to justify taking the "cure".

column2: KMC1968, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Detrol for 2 years and it just stopped working, so I went to a urologist and he switched me to Sanctura XR. THIS MEDICINE WORKS WONDERS! Within 2 days I no longer had to RUSH to the restroom, no more 'accidents', no more 'frequent' trips to the restroom and finally I sleep at night without 'bathroom interruptions'. Now the downside is when trying to read fine print (newspaper), my vision is blurred at times. But the benefits of this medicine far out weigh the side effects, so I have chosen to keep taking it!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for over 6 months, after taking Detrol for a year.  Some days it seems to be working, but that may be due to not drinking much fluids. If I drink even a mere 4oz of water, it doesn't help the frequent urination.

column2: 4kenseth17, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Prescribed Sanctura XL by urologist for dealing with excessive bladder spasming following CYSTOSCOPE SURGERY for removal of KIDNEY STONES.  Have always had trouble with terrible spasming with the "stint" that remains for 7 days after surgery!  Unfortunately, I didn't get much relief from Sanctura XR at all.  It also constipated me.  Best medication I found for this condition is "B & O Suppositories". Don't need many B & O's, but they'll slow the spasming from the stint.  Use caution though...too many can cause diarrhea & it's a narcotic.

column2: ConnieDB, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took Detrol LA for 5 years then quit because it stopped working.  I finally found a doctor who gave me something that works.  This medication worked within  3 days and is working perfectly now.  I am back to doing my usual yard work, gardening and other physical activities and feel normal again.  I continue to wear "light days" pads just in case I push myself too far but that doesn't happen too often. I do have dry mouth and eyes and my throat gets really dry but I drink a lot of water and take Colon clenz, a natural supplement for the constipation.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I do have dryness in my mouth but that's minor as far as I'm concerned. My doctor gave me 2 weeks worth of samples and I just called her to get a prescription so I can take it regularly.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
